title: Canyonlands National Park: Green River Formation
body: Green River Formation        Utah Geological Survey photo       This layer does not occur in Canyonlands but may be seen while rafting the Green River through Desolation Canyon, driving Nine Mile Canyon near Wellington, Utah, or exploring elsewhere in the southeast Uinta Basin.   Deposited: Early Tertiary Period (1.6 to 66 million years ago) Depositional Environment: Lakes Appearance: Continuous grey/brown slopes of shale Examples: Uinta Basin in north-central Utah Note: The Green River Formation contains what might be the largest deposits of oil shale in the world.         Rock Strata   Layer Above: Southeast Utah Mountains   Current Layer: Green River Formation   Layer Below: Wasatch/Claron Formation
